context: HashiCorp, Inc. is a infrastructure automation software company focused on Terraform, Vault, Consul for multi-cloud infrastructure. IBM integration. Enterprise multi-cloud automation.

competitors.name: Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform
competitors.notes: Competes with Terraform in the infrastructure as code space. IT automation and configuration management solution for managing and automating infrastructure and complex workflows.

competitors.name: Puppet Enterprise
competitors.notes: Direct Terraform competitor. IT automation and configuration management solution that enables users to manage and automate infrastructure and complex workflows.

competitors.name: AWS CloudFormation
competitors.notes: Competes with Terraform for infrastructure as code capabilities, specifically for AWS-native deployments and cloud resource management.

competitors.name: CyberArk Privileged Access Manager
competitors.notes: Competes with HashiCorp Vault in the privileged access management and secrets management space for enterprise security.

competitors.name: Akeyless Identity Security Platform
competitors.notes: Direct competitor to HashiCorp Vault for secrets management and privileged access. Provides cloud-native security solutions for identity and access management.

competitors.name: Infisical
competitors.notes: Open source competitor to Vault that emerged after HashiCorp's license change. Provides end-to-end secret management including encrypted version-controlled storage, dynamic secrets, integrations, and certificate lifecycle management.

competitors.name: Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service)
competitors.notes: Competes with HashiCorp Nomad for container orchestration and management, providing AWS-native container deployment capabilities.

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure
competitors.notes: Broad competitor across HashiCorp's cloud management portfolio, offering Azure Automation and native cloud infrastructure tools that compete with Terraform and other HashiCorp products.
